headline: Mercury Insurance Unveils This Year's Most Affordable New Electric Vehicles to Insure
summary: Although the automotive industry's transition to electrification has slowed, many industry experts still agree that electric vehicles are the future and here to stay. For consumers who are in the market for one, Mercury Insurance (NYSE: MCY), a leading auto insurer in California, has compiled a list of the most affordable EVs to insure, announced today. This list was created with the goal of helping budget-conscious consumers find a vehicle that will help them maximize insurance savings.

headline: GM's $1 billion bet on F1 rolls on with star driver pairing for Cadillac team
summary: GM’s Cadillac F1 team unveiled its driver pairing for the 2026 season, when the Big Three automaker’s big bet on F1 begins.

summary: Fuel could spill into the pocket around the gas cap while refueling these vehicles, which could then leak onto an ignition source.

headline: Michigan Employers Step Up Outplacement Amid Ongoing Workforce Shifts
summary: Michigan employers are expanding outplacement as restructuring continues across automotive, healthcare, and tech. Vertical Media Solutions (VMS) reports a significant year-to-date increase in employer requests across all major sectors, reflecting sustained transition activity and a renewed focus on brand-protective separations.

headline: General Motors to recall over 23,500 US vehicles over fuel leak issue, NHTSA says
summary: Fuel could spill into the pocket around the gas cap while refueling these vehicles, which could then leak onto an ignition source, such as hot engine or exhaust components, and cause a fire, the auto safety body said.  As a remedy, dealers will install a shield to divert spilled fuel, NHTSA said.  NHTSA estimates that about 0.1% of the recalled cars have the defect.

As a remedy, dealers will install a shield to divert spilled fuel, NHTSA said.  NHTSA estimates that about 0.1% of the recalled cars have the defect.
